Posts.Content: Hi just finished my docetaxel can recommend zinc tablets for taste. Also speak to the dietician she gives great advice and a great mouth wash.caphosol. Also taking actimel daily and manuka honey 15plus for digestion. Really helped good luck I had last round of docetaxel cancelled due to terrible back pain. But moving on to radiotherphy now. X
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: Has your cancer unit have a dietician I had terrible problems with indijestion and bloating I talked to the dietician at the hospital when I was having chemo she was a great help. And took actimel and manuka honey.  I ended up having to have a course of antibiotics and stronger probiotic after chemo had finished to balance my stomach again. But it's sorted it's self now. All the best x
Posts.Title: Terrible tummy :(

Posts.Content: Hi was diagnosed with breast cancer in my left breast July 2014, had lumpectomy, chemotherapy and radiotherapy.  I am still having Herceptin Injections and am on Tamoxifen. I have tried hard to look after myself since treatment finished, gentle exercise, resting when needed, I returned to work in May this year, on a phased return, and only work part-time. Since being back to work I have had 2 bladder infections, put down to tamoxifen, and a throat infection.  This Monday I ended up in A & E and was admitted to hospital for 2 days, with infection in my left breast and a very high temperature. The infection so bad couldn't do proper scan, and although they believe it is just an infection they would rule out recurrence of cancer. I have an appointment at the breast clinic next week for further tests. But am worried that the cancer has returned. If not why do I keep getting ill. I just want to get back to normal. Has anyone else suffered with this. Hoping someone out there can help. Helen
Posts.Title: worried its come back

Posts.Content: Thanks trying to stay positive and just get well. Then wait and see. Helen x
Posts.Title: worried its come back

Posts.Content: Hi am new to the group, have breast cancer, lumpectomy in August. Now having chemotherapy. Had 3 lots of fec which was hard as I felt very sick, ended up in hospital with an infection. Have now had my first lot of herceptin and docetaxel. Have suffered with terrible aches and pains that had to get morphine to cope. This was one week and 2 days ago, am still struggling with the side effects, eating is becoming a problem, and am now worring about the next round on 20th Feb. Can anyone help who has been there, i know i should be pleased as i only have 2 more to go, then radiotherapy, but I'm so tired and feel so ill all the time that not sure i can continue. Can anyone give me ideas to help, looking forward t hearing from anyone
Posts.Title: Struggling after forth chemo

Posts.Content: Hi thanks to you all for your messages and tips. I am looking into increasing juicing, manukca honey and trying a bit more walking.  Have made an appointment with the dietician to have a chat and will have a good talk with my oncologist before the next lot. Was expecting it to be hard, but with the fec. I felt rubbish for about a week, 13 days in after Herceptin and T, no sign feeling better before the next. Luckily I have a great family and friends who are helping. Good wishes to all who are going through treatment or any form of cancer
Posts.Title: Struggling after forth chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I have booked to have a tattoo, and am currently having herceptin injections every 3 weeks, finished chemo in Feb and radiotherapy in April. Does anyone know if it is okay to go ahead with tattoo whilst still having herceptin. Thanks
Posts.Title: tattoo whilst on herceptin

Posts.Content: Having it on my right wrist, left breastfeeding cancer, so that's ok. Having a half heart and breast cancer ribbon, found it on pintrest. My daughter and I are also having a small star, which will go just at the bottom of the ribbon. Thanks for your help. X
Posts.Title: tattoo whilst on herceptin

Posts.Content: Thanks seeing oncologist again next week, will mention if not better.
Posts.Title: headaches

Posts.Content: Hi had my last chemo for breastfeeding cancer doceltaxel on 20th January due to major pain issues had to have longer dose of steroids plus other pain relief. However have not been taking any pain relief for at least 2 weeks, but am still struggling with headaches not always bad but in the background most of the time.  Any one else had this and will they get better. Thanks
Posts.Title: headaches
